p: Monoterpenes, in both their oxygenated and hydrocarbon forms (74 and 19.7%, respectively), represented the main chemical class for the EO of C. nubigenum. Monoterpenes were also the most abundant chemical class of compounds in the EO of L. angustifolia, as they accounted for up to 94.6% of the total composition, mostly in their oxygenated form (82.4%) ( Table 1).
